Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
ENGR3QA
Are you ready to work with some of the industry's best and build software that runs at a scale that very few organizations on the planet can claim? We develop world-class engineers while placing a heavy focus on developing your leadership. Our culture stresses craftsmanship, leadership, and most importantly having fun.
Comcast's Technology & Product division is looking for a self-motivated, senior level software developer in test (SDET) to validate the design and implementation of X1 for XFINITY TV, the company's flagship video product and customer experience. At Comcast we work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and we challenge ourselves to be the best video product on the market. We're seeking a SDET who has a passion for delivering highly polished visual experiences for use by broad audiences.
Key Responsibilities
Independently author test cases for large scale system changes that touch many areas of the application and have broad performance implications. Test cases would include calling patterns to downstream services, caching behavior, analysis of application logs, system performance and resiliency including CPU and memory usage, and failure cases.Actively solicit and consider input from multiple engineers when creating or revising test cases.Demonstrate expertise in creating test cases, including peer review, providing meaningful feedback.Proactively migrate repetitive, manual tests into the automated integration test platform.Review Product and System Requirements provide feedback on Acceptance Criteria and how requirements can be improved.Coordinate defect management and triage functions, working cross-functionally to resolve issues.Provide regular communication and documentation of project status and issues requiring escalation.Provide documentation and details on the system and features including flowcharts, Network diagrams, Data Flow diagrams, and Sequence diagrams to help in train fellow Engineers.Utilize available tools to Monitor System health and performance. Report and escalate issues that impact Customer Experience and Performance of the System.Collaborate effectively with a tight-knit team containing developers, QA testers, product owners and project managersWork in a dynamic, team-oriented environment using agile methodologies
Skills & Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or equivalent field of study) from an accredited university3-5 years experience testing software applications1-2 years experience developing tests using automated testing frameworksIdeal candidate will have Java development experience which can be leveraged for building automated test frameworks.Experience with one or more code version control systemsDemonstrated experience testing complex user interface applicationsExperience working effectively in a corporate settingExcellent verbal and written communication skillsCan lead team membersBreak down and identify test case scenerios and write test cases to test feature, generate test cases and do test executionBack end and Front end testing (UX and testing web services)Understanding new features and being able to determine best path for testingA passion for working in technology as demonstrated by personal project work, open-source contributions, personal websites or participation in tech communities
Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer
